mse/channel.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 1
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse
FIELD_NAME: channel
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Set of channels (lines of sight)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic

=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/detector
IDS: mse

PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> detector

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)

mse/channel/detector/geometry_type.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/detector/geometry_type
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/detector
FIELD_NAME: geometry_type
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> detector -> geometry_type

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/detector]: Detector description

mse/channel/detector/centre.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/detector/centre
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/detector
FIELD_NAME: centre
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> detector -> centre

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/detector]: Detector description

mse/channel/detector/x1_unit_vector.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/detector/x1_unit_vector
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/detector
FIELD_NAME: x1_unit_vector
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> detector -> x1_unit_vector

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). 

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/detector]: Detector description

mse/channel/detector/x2_unit_vector.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/detector/x2_unit_vector
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/detector
FIELD_NAME: x2_unit_vector
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> detector -> x2_unit_vector

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/detector]: Detector description

mse/channel/aperture/centre/r.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/aperture/centre/r
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 4
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 5
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/aperture/centre
FIELD_NAME: r
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> aperture -> centre -> r

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Major radius

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/aperture]: Description of a set of collimating apertures
CONTAINER[mse/channel/aperture/centre]: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

FIELD_NAME: phi

PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> aperture -> centre -> phi

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

mse/channel/aperture/x1_unit_vector.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/aperture/x1_unit_vector
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/aperture
FIELD_NAME: x1_unit_vector
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> aperture -> x1_unit_vector

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). 

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/aperture]: Description of a set of collimating apertures

mse/channel/aperture/x2_unit_vector.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/aperture/x2_unit_vector
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/aperture
FIELD_NAME: x2_unit_vector
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> aperture -> x2_unit_vector

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/aperture]: Description of a set of collimating apertures

mse/channel/aperture/x3_unit_vector.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/aperture/x3_unit_vector
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/aperture
FIELD_NAME: x3_unit_vector
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> aperture -> x3_unit_vector

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/aperture]: Description of a set of collimating apertures

=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel
FIELD_NAME: active_spatial_resolution
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> active_spatial_resolution

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)

mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution/ge.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution/geometric_coefficients
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution
FIELD_NAME: geometric_coefficients
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> active_spatial_resolution -> geometric_coefficients

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Set of 9 geometric coefficients providing the MSE polarization angle as a function of the local electric and magnetic field components (these are related to the angle between beam and line of sight). The list is ordered as follows : coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER (numerator of the MSE angle expression); coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER, EZ (denominator)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution]: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse)

mse/channel/polarization_angle/validity_.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: mse/channel/polarization_angle/validity_timed
IDS: mse
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/polarization_angle
FIELD_NAME: validity_timed
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> polarization_angle -> validity_timed

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/polarization_angle]: MSE polarization angle

PARENT_CONTAINER: mse/channel/polarization_angle
FIELD_NAME: validity
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: mse -> channel -> polarization_angle -> validity

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[mse]: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic
CONTAINER[mse/channel]: Set of channels (lines of sight)
CONTAINER[mse/channel/polarization_angle]: MSE polarization angle
